sections.title: Teeth whitening in Shoreham-by-Sea
sections.body:
Teeth whitening is a treatment designed to lighten the natural colour of your teeth. It does not change the structure of the teeth, but works by breaking down stains that have built up over time.

Whitening can be effective, but results vary between individuals. The starting shade of your teeth, the type of staining present, and your general oral health all influence how much lightening is possible.

Before considering whitening, it’s important to understand what it can and cannot achieve. A proper assessment helps ensure the treatment is suitable and expectations are realistic.
bullets: Custom-fit trays made from digital scans
UK-permitted gels prescribed and supervised by your dentist
Shade targets that respect enamel, gums, and existing restorations
Sequenced with aligners, bonding, or veneers so shade is locked in first

sections.title: Measured change with custom trays and follow-up
sections.body:
Professional whitening uses regulated whitening gels that penetrate the tooth surface and break down stain molecules.

This process lightens the tooth from within rather than removing enamel. When used correctly under dental supervision, it is a controlled and predictable treatment.

Over-the-counter products may appear similar but are limited in strength and effectiveness under UK regulations.
bullets: Custom trays from digital scans for sealed, even gel placement

Guidance to reduce sensitivity and protect gums
Advice on how whitening interacts with veneers, crowns, and fillings
Clear steps for top-ups using the same trays when indicated

sections.title: Protocols that keep whitening comfortable
sections.body:
Not everyone is suitable for teeth whitening.

Healthy teeth and gums are essential before treatment. Whitening does not change the colour of fillings, crowns, or veneers, which can affect the final appearance if these are present on visible teeth.

We assess your oral health, existing dental work, and the cause of discolouration before recommending whitening. In some cases, alternative treatments may be more appropriate.

sections.eyebrow: Whitening as part of ABC dentistry
sections.title: Align → Bleach → Composite or veneers
sections.body:
Teeth whitening can lighten natural tooth colour, but it cannot produce a specific shade on demand.

Some types of staining respond better than others, and results are gradual rather than instant. Whitening also does not permanently prevent future staining, so maintenance may be required.

Understanding these limits helps avoid disappointment and supports long-term satisfaction with the result.
bullets: Aligners or orthodontics establish positions before shade work
Whitening locks in a natural shade to match future composites or veneers
Composite or porcelain is planned after bleaching to avoid re-making restorations
Review points keep the plan compliant and comfortable at every stage

faqs.question: Is dentist-led whitening safe?
faqs.answer: Yes. Whitening starts after a clinical assessment and uses UK-regulated gels in custom trays to protect enamel and gums.

faqs.question: What if my teeth feel sensitive?
faqs.answer: Sensitivity can happen. We adjust wear times, use desensitising toothpaste or gels, and pause treatment if symptoms persist.

faqs.question: How long do results last?
faqs.answer: Whitening results vary, but many people find results last months to years depending on habits, maintenance, and individual response.

sections.title: When this fits and what else to consider
sections.body:
Professional whitening is usually carried out using custom-made trays worn at home, sometimes combined with in-practice treatment depending on individual needs.

Your dentist will explain the available options, how they work, and what level of change is realistic for you before any treatment begins.
